content.raw:
@{557058:cbf1bc43-1dc2-477b-9e25-1a8f40fd7ee3} I’m tempted to decline this one in favour of creating a more general purpose cache that can handle an arbitrary data path in the HDF5 file and applies to all methods of `Run` and possibly something that rolls the cache over so it can’t grow forever.

Either way, I think this concept could be fleshed out significantly more and I don’t think we should merge something to the lyse API that is not in the form we want.
content.html:
@Chris Billington I’m tempted to decline this one in favour of creating a more general purpose cache that can handle an arbitrary data path in the HDF5 file and applies to all methods of Run and possibly something that rolls the cache over so it can’t grow forever.

Either way, I think this concept could be fleshed out significantly more and I don’t think we should merge something to the lyse API that is not in the form we want.
